samples.name: Base2D
samples.description: 2d applications can be created by extending `hxd.App` and then you can attach drawables to `s2d`, which is the root scene for 2d.

samples.name: Base3D
samples.description: 3d applications can be created by extending `hxd.App` and then you can attach meshes to `s3d`, which is the root scene for 3d.

samples.name: AdjustColor
samples.description: With Heaps it is easy to change colors of bitmaps using the `drawable.adjustColor` function. This is a convenience method for changing the color matrix (`drawable.colorMatrix`) which allows to do even more advanced color transformations.

samples.name: Bounds
samples.description: In H2D getting the local transformed bounding box of an object is as simple as calling `getBounds()`.

samples.name: CollideCheck
samples.description: Heaps has support for several 2d and 3d collision checks

samples.name: Cursor
samples.description: Setting the mouse cursor can be done by setting `s.cursor` to a `hxd.Cursor` value.

samples.name: Filters
samples.description: Heaps has several build-in filters. Of course its possible to create your own, see [filters in the documentation](/documentation/h2d/filters.html)

samples.name: GraphicsDraw
samples.description: The Graphics class contains methods used to draw primitive shapes such as lines, circles and rectangles

samples.name: Interactive
samples.description: Heaps has support for [2d interaction events](/documentation/h2d/events-and-interactivity.html) and [3d interaction events](/documentation/h3d/events-and-interactivity.html).

samples.name: Shadows
samples.description: Heaps has build-in support for fast shadows.

samples.name: Sound
samples.description: Heaps supports sound on all platforms
